context: A recent incident involved using PsExec to remotely execute commands, potentially indicating lateral movement attempts by an attacker. Specifically, the commands executed include `notepad.exe` and `cmd.exe`, with `cmd.exe` having a Process ID of 8656 and timestamp `2024-06-20t09:07:09.5458894z`. This activity suggests attackers may be targeting devices within the organization.
question: In relation to this sequence of activities, there was also a possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT). Can you identify the file name of the process used in this attempt?
solution_steps: PsExec launched a command on a remote device with AadDeviceId `4d8d23e9-a77d-4e33-9435-b8c457e57ca1`.
There was a possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token using the process `powershell.exe`.
